title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total consumer surplus as $31 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, Ahmet would be able to buy 3 books and 2 units of Good D and/or does not explain that his total expenditures would be $14 (=3×$4+2×$1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaey41aqRaaiijaiaaisdacqGHRaWkcaaI YaGaey41aqRaaiijaiaaigdacaGGPaaaaa@43AA@ , which is less than his weekly income of $18.

The response states that yes, Ahmet would be able to buy 3 books and 2 units of Good D and explains that his total expenditures would be $14 (=3×$4+2×$1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaey41aqRaaiijaiaaisdacqGHRaWkcaaI YaGaey41aqRaaiijaiaaigdacaGGPaaaaa@43AA@ , which is less than his weekly income of $18.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 3 books and 6 units of Good D will maximize Ahmet’s total benefit given his weekly income of $18 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of books (1) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good D (1), or

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that Ahmet’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for books would increase the demand for books, which would increase the price of books, and an increase in the price of books would increase the total cost of 5 books while the total benefit of 5 books remains the same.

· States that the quantity of books that will maximize Ahmet’s total benefit will decrease and explains that there has been an increase in the price of books which decreases the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Ahmet gets from each additional book.

The response does one of the following:

· States that Ahmet’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for books would increase the demand for books, which would increase the price of books, and an increase in the price of books would increase the total cost of 5 books while the total benefit of 5 books remains the same.

· States that the quantity of books that will maximize Ahmet’s total benefit will decrease and explains that there has been an increase in the price of books which decreases the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Ahmet gets from each additional book.

The response does both of the following:

· States that Ahmet’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for books would increase the demand for books, which would increase the price of books, and an increase in the price of books would increase the total cost of 5 books while the total benefit of 5 books remains the same.

· States that the quantity of books that will maximize Ahmet’s total benefit will decrease and explains that there has been an increase in the price of books which decreases the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Ahmet gets from each additional book.
